text: Artvin Province (Laz and Georgian: ართვინი, romanized: artvini; Armenian: Արտուին, romanized: Artuin) is a province in Turkey, on the Black Sea coast in the northeastern corner of the country, on the border with Georgia. {{Infobox settlement | name = Artvin | population_as_of = 2020 | leader_name = | leader_title1 = | leader_name1 = | total_type = Total | area_total_km2 = 7436 | population_footnotes = | population_total = 169,501 | population_density_km2 = auto | coordinates = | population_urban = | population_urban_footnotes = | population_rural = | population_rural_footnotes = | area_code_type = | area_code = | registration_plate = | website = | leader_title = Electoral district | seat1 = | native_name = Artuin Արտուին Artvini ართვინი | mapsize = 300px | native_name_lang = tr | settlement_type = Province | image_skyline = | image_caption = A view of Artvin | image_flag = | image_seal = | image_map = Artvin in Turkey.svg | map_caption = Location of Artvin Province in Turkey | seat1_type = Largest city | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Turkey | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name1 = East Black Sea | subdivision_type2 = | subdivision_name2 = | seat_type = Provincial seat and largest city | seat = | footnotes = | imagesize = 250px }} Armenian (Hemshin),Simonian, Hovann (2007). The Hemshin: History, Society and Identity in the Highlands of Northeast Turkey. Routledge. p. 320, "The Hemshin People live in [...] from the county of Çayeli, in the province of Rize, as far east as the Georgian border of the county of Hopa, in the province of Artvin." Georgian, Laz and Turkish people live in Artvin. == References == == Notes == Category:Provinces of Turkey Category:Black Sea Region
title: Artvin Province
